metadata.feature_description: Interface for selecting analytics time periods and date ranges for all analytics views

steps.action: Navigate to Community Analytics via PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard loads with date selector visible
steps.actual: Community Analytics dashboard loaded showing Answers module with date selector '2 Feb 2026 - 8 Feb 2026'

steps.action: Click on date selector to open period dropdown
steps.expected: Period dropdown appears with Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom options
steps.actual: Period dropdown appeared with all expected options: Day, Week (selected), Month, Year, Custom

steps.expected: Date range updates to single day, comparative term changes to '1 d', chart shows hourly intervals
steps.actual: Date changed to '8 Feb 2026', comparative term changed to '1 d', engagement chart now shows hourly intervals (00:00, 03:00, etc.)

steps.action: Click on date selector and select 'Month' period
steps.expected: Date range updates to 1 month span, comparative term changes to '1 m'
steps.actual: Date range changed to '9 Jan 2026 - 8 Feb 2026', comparative term changed to '1 m', chart shows daily intervals

steps.action: Click on date selector and select 'Year' period
steps.expected: Date range updates to 1 year span, chart shows monthly intervals
steps.actual: Date range changed to '9 Feb 2025 - 8 Feb 2026', chart shows monthly intervals (FEB, MAR, APR, etc.)

steps.action: Click on date selector and select 'Custom' option
steps.expected: Custom date picker with dual calendars appears showing From and To dates
steps.actual: Custom date picker appeared with two calendar views - left for 'From' date (February 2025), right for 'To' date (February 2026), with Apply button

steps.action: Select January 1, 2026 as start date by changing month to January and year to 2026, then click on day 1
steps.expected: From date updates to show selected date
steps.actual: From date updated to '2026-01-01' as shown in the header label

steps.action: Click Apply button to apply custom date range
steps.expected: Custom date range is applied and displayed in the date selector
steps.actual: Custom date range '1 Jan 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' applied successfully, charts updated to show JAN and FEB months

steps.action: Observe custom calendar date picker for disabled dates
steps.expected: Future dates beyond today (Feb 9, 2026) should be disabled/grayed out
steps.actual: Future dates (Feb 10-28, 2026) are grayed out and not clickable on the 'To' calendar. Future months (March-December) are disabled in the month dropdown. The 'Next Month' button is also disabled on the To calendar.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify data updates on period change

steps.action: Observe chart data when changing from Week to Day period
steps.expected: Chart labels update to reflect new time period granularity
steps.actual: When changing to Day period, chart labels changed from weekday names (MON, TUE, etc.) to hourly intervals (00:00, 03:00, 06:00, etc.)

steps.action: Observe chart data when changing to Year period
steps.expected: Chart labels update to show monthly intervals
steps.actual: When changing to Year period, chart labels changed to show monthly intervals (FEB, MAR, APR, MAY, JUN, JUL, AUG, SEP, OCT, NOV, DEC, JAN)

steps.action: Apply custom date range and observe chart update
steps.expected: Chart updates to show data for custom date range
steps.actual: After applying custom range (Jan 1 - Feb 8, 2026), chart shows JAN and FEB labels reflecting the selected period

steps.action: Set custom date range on Answers tab (1 Jan 2026 - 8 Feb 2026)
steps.expected: Custom date range is set on Answers tab
steps.actual: Custom date range '1 Jan 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' set successfully on Answers tab

steps.action: Switch to Blogs tab by clicking on Blogs in the navigation
steps.expected: Blogs tab should retain the same date range as Answers tab for consistency
steps.actual: Blogs tab shows different date range '2 Feb 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' with comparative term '1 w' (Week) - period settings are NOT persisted across social module tabs

issues: Period selection does not persist across social module tabs (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, etc.). Each tab maintains its own independent period settings. This may be by design but could lead to confusion for users who expect consistent date ranges across all analytics views.

observations: Each social module tab (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) maintains its own independent period/date selection - period changes on one tab do not affect other tabs
The code uses Pikaday library for the custom date picker calendar component
Comparative Term dropdown dynamically updates based on selected period: Day shows '1 d', Week shows '1 w', Month shows '1 m', Year shows '1 y'
Period settings are saved to browser persistent storage (utility.persistent.save) within each module's context
A minor JavaScript error occurred when applying custom dates (TypeError: utility.moment is not a function) but did not prevent the feature from working
